title: `debug_trace*` requires `tracerConfig` to be set
body:
### üêõ Bug Report
Hi team!
Seems that there is a bug either in docs or in implementation.
In [docs](https://era.zksync.io/docs/api/api.html#debug-traceblockbynumber) `tracerConfig` described as optional argument, but when I actually query the public rpc or my NaaS provider nodes I receive the error `missing field `tracerConfig` at line 1 column 24`


```sh
$ curl --location 'https://mainnet.era.zksync.io' \
--header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
--data '{"jsonrpc": "2.0",
	"id":1,
	"method":"debug_traceBlockByNumber",
	"params":["0x11a8bf6",{"tracer": "callTracer"}]
}'
# Response
{
    "jsonrpc": "2.0",
    "error": {
        "code": -32602,
        "message": "Invalid params",
        "data": "missing field `tracerConfig` at line 1 column 24"
    },
    "id": 1
}
```

However setting the `tracerConfig` fixes the problem, but it's wrong documented behaviour.

```sh
$ curl --location 'https://mainnet.era.zksync.io' \
--header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
--data '{"jsonrpc": "2.0",
	"id":1,
	"method":"debug_traceBlockByNumber",
	"params":["0x11a8bf6",{"tracer": "callTracer", "tracerConfig": { "onlyTopCall": false }}]
}'

{
    "jsonrpc": "2.0",
    "result": [
        {
            "result": {
                "type": "Call",
                "from": "0x0000000000000000000000000000000000000000",
                "to": "0x0000000000000000000000000000000000008001",
                "gas": "0x8b14b",
                "gasUsed": "0x51b39",
                "value": "0x0",
                "output": "0x",
                "input": "0x095ea7b3000000000000000000000000be7d1fd1f6748bbdefc4fbacafbb11c6fc506d1d0000000000000000000000000000000000000000000000000000000001312d00",
                "error": null,
                "revertReason": null,
                "calls": ...
}
```

Hi!

This happens because you still include the `{"tracer": "callTracer"}` param, but it also expects a `tracerConfig` in that JSON object in the second parameter. For example, this request will not fail:

```
curl --location 'https://mainnet.era.zksync.io' \
--header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
--data '{"jsonrpc": "2.0",
        "id":1,
        "method":"debug_traceBlockByNumber",
        "params":["0x11a8bf6"]
}'
```

Inside the code, the `TracerConfig` is optional:

https://github.com/matter-labs/zksync-era/blob/ab31f031dfcaa7ddf296786ddccb78e8edd2d3c5/core/lib/web3_decl/src/namespaces/debug.rs#L20-L25

But inside the `TracerConfig`, the `tracerConfig` is not optional:

https://github.com/matter-labs/zksync-era/blob/ab31f031dfcaa7ddf296786ddccb78e8edd2d3c5/core/lib/types/src/api/mod.rs#L636-L641

This means that you either include the whole parameter (`{"tracer": "callTracer", "tracerConfig": { "onlyTopCall": false }}`) like you did in the second call or you don't use a 2nd parameter at all.



Now for the zkSync team, should the `tracer_config` inside the `TracerConfig` struct be optional (like ethereum)? Or is this expected behaviour?

Note, this call works on Ethereum, which is what the original poster tried to request but on zkSync. It does not include the `"tracerConfig": { "onlyTopCall": false }`:

```
curl --location 'https://docs-demo.quiknode.pro' \
--header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
--data '{"jsonrpc": "2.0",
        "id":1,
        "method":"debug_traceBlockByNumber",
        "params":["0x11B2CD1",{"tracer": "callTracer"}]
}'
```
